abstracts.cdata!:
The credit would support GECAMINES'
            efforts to restructure its organization and improve its
            management. It would also help finance preparation of the
            Company's long-term rehabilitation and expansion. The
            project would include the following: (a) a revaluation of
            GECAMINES' fixed assets and assessment of the
            Company's net worth; (b) a study of GECAMINES'
            overhead costs and recommendations for major overhead cost
            reductions; and (c) a study of GECAMINES' metallurgical
            operations to identify areas where technical efficiency can
            be improved. Consultants' services would include: (a)
            technical assistant to GECAMINES' open pit mining and
            maintenance operations for the Western Group to increase
            productivity and provide on-the-job training; (b)
            establishment of a Marketing Department within GECAMINES to
            increase its role in the commercialization of its products;
            (c) review of the Finance Department current procedures and
            establishment of a long-term financing strategy; (d)
            organization and training assistance; and (e) legal
            assistance to review GECAMINES' contractual obligation.
